intro: Nigera daucoides, commonly known as the black carrot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces dark purple to black fruits, which are used in traditional medicine and as a dye. Its roots are not typically consumed but are sometimes used in herbal remedies. Nigera daucoides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
